lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/PooPoo.PooPoo.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run PooPoo.PooPoo.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
[E][ ] finish coding (from: now to: when I retire)
PooPoo is a simple chatbot that helps you manage your tasks efficiently. You can add tasks, list them, mark them as done, delete tasks, and save your progress.
Add a task with a deadline to the task list.
A short message will tell the user that the deadline is added to the tasklist.
Okiee I've added the deadline!! Make sure you do it by then!
Add a task with a specific start event date and end date to the task list.
Example: `event finish coding /from now /to when I retire`
A short message will tell the user that the event is added to the tasklist.
Okiee I've added the event!! All the best!
Add a task without a deadline to the task list.
A short message will tell the user that the task has been added to the tasklist.
List all tasks in the task list.
A list of tasks will be shown.
2. [E][ ] finish coding (from: now to: when I retire)
Delete a task from the task list. Task number can be found by using the list command.
A short message will be shown to show that the task has been deleted from the tasklist.
You have 2 remaining tasks left! All the best!
Mark a task as done/undone in the task list. Task number can be found by using the list command.
A short message will be shown to show that the task has been marked as done/undone in the tasklist.
Thank you! I have marked it as done! Good job!
Find tasks that contain a specific keyword. Tasks that contain the keyword would be shown.
A list of tasks that contain the keyword would be shown.
These are the matching tasks in the list!:
1. [E][X] finish coding (from: now to: when I retire)
A short message will be shown, then the program will exit.
Bye! Hope to see you again!
Task list data is saved in the hard disk automatically after any command that changes the data. There is no need to save manually.
Task list data is saved as a text file data/tasks.txt. Advanced users are welcome to update data directly by editing that data file.
* The {@code PooPoo} class serves as the main entry point for the application.
* It initializes the necessary components and manages user interactions
// Storage, task list, and UI instances for managing tasks and user interaction.
* The main method that starts the PooPoo task manager.
* It initializes the storage, task list, and user interface,
* then enters a loop to process user commands until the exit command is given.
String fullCommand = Ui.readCommand();  // Read user input
Command c = Parser.parse(fullCommand);  // Parse input into a command
c.execute(tasks, ui, storage);  // Execute the command
isExit = c.isExit();    // Check if the command signals program exit
* The {@code Command} class represents an abstract command that can be executed.
* Subclasses should implement the {@code execute} method to define specific command behavior.
* Executes the command using the provided task list, UI, and storage.
* Each subclass should provide its own implementation.
* @param tasks   The task list that the command interacts with.
* @param ui      The UI instance for user interactions.
* @param storage The storage system for saving or retrieving tasks.
* @throws PooPooException If an error occurs during execution.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws PooPooException;
* Indicates whether this command should terminate the program.
* By default, commands do not cause the program to exit.
* @return {@code false} unless overridden by an exit command.
* The {@code DeadlineCommand} class handles the creation and addition of a
* {@code Deadline} task to the task list.
* Constructs a {@code DeadlineCommand} with the given description and due date.
* @param description The description of the deadline task.
* @param by The due date of the deadline task.
* Executes the deadline command by adding a new {@code Deadline} task to the task list.
* Displays the added task using the UI and saves the updated task list to storage.
* @param tasks   The task list to which the deadline task is added.
* @param ui      The UI instance used to display the task addition.
* @param storage The storage system where tasks are saved.
* @throws PooPooException If an error occurs during execution.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws PooPooException {
* The {@code DeleteCommand} class handles the removal of a task from the task list.
* Constructs a {@code DeleteCommand} with the specified task index.
* @param index The index of the task to be deleted (1-based index).
* Executes the delete command by removing a task from the task list.
* Displays the deleted task using the UI, updates the remaining task count,
* and saves the updated task list to storage.
* @param tasks   The task list from which the task will be removed.
* @param ui      The UI instance used to display the task deletion.
* @param storage The storage system where the updated task list is saved.
* @throws PooPooException If an error occurs during execution.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* The {@code EventCommand} class handles the creation and addition of an
* {@code Event} task to the task list.
* Constructs an {@code EventCommand} with the given description, start time, and end time.
* @param description The description of the event.
* @param from        The start time of the event.
* @param to          The end time of the event.
public EventCommand(String description, String from, String to) {
* Executes the event command by adding a new {@code Event} task to the task list.
* Displays the added event using the UI and saves the updated task list to storage.
* @param tasks   The task list to which the event is added.
* @param ui      The UI instance used to display the task addition.
* @param storage The storage system where tasks are saved.
* @throws PooPooException If an error occurs during execution.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws PooPooException {
Event eventTask = new Event(description, from, to);
* The {@code ExitCommand} class handles the termination of the program.
* Executes the exit command by displaying the farewell message.
* This command does not modify the task list or storage.
* @param tasks   The task list (not used in this command).
* @param ui      The UI instance used to display the farewell message.
* @param storage The storage system (not used in this command).
public void execute (TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
public void execute (TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* The {@code ListCommand} class handles displaying all tasks in the task list.
* Executes the list command by displaying all tasks in the task list.
* @param tasks   The task list containing tasks to be displayed.
* @param ui      The UI instance used to display the list of tasks.
* @param storage The storage system (not used in this command).
* @throws PooPooException If an error occurs during execution.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws PooPooException {
* The {@code MarkCommand} class handles marking a task as completed.
* Constructs a {@code MarkCommand} with the specified task index.
* @param index The index of the task to be marked as completed (1-based index).
* Executes the mark command by marking the specified task as done.
* Displays the updated task status using the UI and saves the updated task list to storage.
* @param tasks   The task list containing the task to be marked as completed.
* @param ui      The UI instance used to display the marked task.
* @param storage The storage system where the updated task list is saved.
public void execute (TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* The {@code TodoCommand} class handles the creation and addition of a
* {@code ToDo} task to the task list.
* Constructs a {@code TodoCommand} with the given description.
* @param description The description of the ToDo task.
* Executes the ToDo command by adding a new {@code ToDo} task to the task list.
* Displays the added task using the UI and saves the updated task list to storage.
* @param tasks   The task list to which the ToDo task is added.
* @param ui      The UI instance used to display the task addition.
* @param storage The storage system where tasks are saved.
public void execute (TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* The {@code Parser} class is responsible for interpreting user input
* and returning the corresponding {@code Command} object.
* Parses the user input and returns the appropriate {@code Command} object based on the input command word.
* @param input The raw input string entered by the user.
* @return A {@code Command} object corresponding to the input command.
* @throws PooPooException If the input is invalid or cannot be processed.
public static Command parse(String input) throws PooPooException {
// Returns a command that lists all tasks.

// Ensures that a description is provided for the todo task.

* The {@code Storage} class handles the saving and loading of tasks from a file.
* It ensures task data persistence between program executions.
// Stores the list of tasks with an initial capacity of 100.
public static ArrayList<Task> taskList = new ArrayList<>(100);
* Saves the current task list to the default file path.
* If an error occurs during saving, an error message is displayed.
* @param tasks The task list to be saved.
* Saves the provided task list to the specified file path.
* Creates directories if they do not exist.
* @param tasks    The task list to be saved.
* @param filePath The file path where the tasks should be saved.
* @throws IOException If an error occurs while writing to the file.
public static void saveTaskList(TaskList tasks, String filePath) throws IOException {
// Writes each task as a string representation to the file.
* Restores the task list from the specified file.
* If the file does not exist, it creates a new file.
* @param filePath The file path where tasks are stored.
* @return A {@code TaskList} object containing the restored tasks.
// If the file doesn't exist, create the necessary directories and an empty file.
// Regular expression to parse task entries from the file.
// Reads each line from the file and reconstructs tasks.
String type = matcher.group(1);           // T (ToDo), D (Deadline), or E (Event)
String doneSymbol = matcher.group(2);     // " " for not done, "X" for done
String details = matcher.group(3);        // The task details
// Extracts the description and deadline from the string.
// Extracts the description, start time, and end time for an Event.
* The {@code Deadline} class represents a task with a specific due date.
* It extends the {@code Task} class and includes a deadline.
* Constructs a {@code Deadline} task with the specified description and due date.
* @param description The description of the deadline task.
* @param by          The due date of the task.
* Retrieves the due date of the deadline task.
* @return The due date as a string.
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task,
* including its type, description, and due date.
* @return A formatted string representing the deadline task.
* The {@code Event} class represents a task that occurs within a specific time range.
* It extends the {@code Task} class and includes a start time and an end time.
* Constructs an {@code Event} task with the specified description, start time, and end time.
* @param description The description of the event.
* @param from        The start time of the event.
* @param to          The end time of the event.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* Retrieves the start time of the event.
* @return The start time as a string.
* Retrieves the end time of the event.
* @return The end time as a string.
* Returns a string representation of the event task,
* including its type, description, start time, and end time.
* @return A formatted string representing the event task.
* The {@code Task} class represents a general task with a description
* Constructs a {@code Task} with the specified description.
* By default, the task is marked as not done.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Retrieves the status icon representing whether the task is done.
* @return "X" if the task is done, otherwise a space character.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // Mark done task with X
* Returns a string representation of the task,
* @return A formatted string representing the task.
* Checks if the task is completed.
* @return {@code true} if the task is completed, {@code false} otherwise.
* Retrieves the description of the task.
* Represents a list of tasks. Provides methods to add, delete, retrieve, and manipulate tasks.
// Stores the list of tasks with an initial capacity of 100.
public static ArrayList<Task> taskList = new ArrayList<>(100);
* Adds a task to the task list
* @param task The task to be added
* Deletes a task from the task list based on the given index
* @param taskIndex The index of the task to be removed (1-based index).
* Retrieves a task from the task list.
* @param index The index of the task to retrieve (1-based index).
* @return The task at the specified index.
* Returns the total number of tasks in the task list.
* @return The size of the task list.
* Displays all tasks in the task list.
* Uses the Ui class to display each task.
* Marks a task as done based on the given index.
* @param taskIndex The index of the task to mark as done (1-based index).
* Returns the full list of tasks.
* The {@code ToDo} class represents a simple task without a specific deadline or time range.
* Constructs a {@code ToDo} task with the given description.
* @param description The description of the ToDo task.
* Returns a string representation of the ToDo task,
* @return A formatted string representing the ToDo task.
* The {@code PooPooException} class represents a custom exception
* used to handle errors specific to the PooPoo application.
* The {@code Ui} class handles user interactions in the PooPoo application.
* It provides methods to display messages, read user input, and handle errors.
// Static messages used throughout the UI.
protected static String ASK = "How can I help you?";
protected static String BYE = "Bye! Hope to see you again!";
* Displays the welcome message when the application starts.
System.out.println("Hii! Nice to meet you! I'm " + NAME);
* Displays the goodbye message when the application exits.
* Displays an error message when an unknown command is entered.
* Displays an error message when an invalid index is entered.
* Displays an error message when the task data file is not found.
* Displays a confirmation message when a task is marked as done.
System.out.println("Thank you! I have marked it as done! Good job!");
* Displays a confirmation message when a deadline task is added.
System.out.println("Okiee I've added the deadline!! Make sure you do it by then!");
* Displays a confirmation message when an event task is added.
System.out.println("Okiee I've added the event!! All the best!");
* Displays a confirmation message when a ToDo task is added.
* Displays a confirmation message when a task is deleted.
* @param index The index of the deleted task.
System.out.println("Okiee I've removed this task: \n" + TaskList.getTask(index));
* Displays the number of remaining tasks in the task list.
System.out.println("You have " + TaskList.getSize() + " remaining tasks left! All the best!");
* Displays a specific task from the task list.
* @param index The index of the task to display.
* Reads and returns a command input from the user.
* @return The user input as a string.
System.out.println("These are the matching tasks in the list!: \n");
